def.dt: :so unpleasant to see, smell, taste, consider, etc., that you feel slightly sick The food was disgusting. [=(informally) gross] She finds the idea of eating meat totally disgusting. [=repulsive] a disgusting [=repugnant] photograph
:so bad, unfair, inappropriate, etc., that you feel annoyed and angry I think the way the news media focuses on celebrities is disgusting. [=repugnant] What a disgusting way to treat people.

utxt.vi: (informal + humorous) a disgustingly good player [=an extremely good player]

def.dt: :to cause (someone) to have a strong feeling of dislike for something especially because it has a very unpleasant appearance, taste, smell, etc. The greasy food they were serving disgusted [=repulsed] him. She's a vegetarian because the idea of eating meat totally disgusts her.
def.ssl: of something bad, unfair, improper, etc.
def.dt: :to cause (someone) to feel very annoyed and angry The way the news media focuses on celebrities disgusts [=revolts] me. The photographs disgust some people.
